sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Parliament physick for a sin-sick nation. Or, An ordinance of Parliament explained, and applyed to these diseased times. Containing a catholicall medicine for all natures and nations, but especially, a generall receipt for all the sickly people in our English-hospitall, and Welch-spittle, compounded after the art of the apothecary, and according to Parliament prescription, as hereafter followeth. Wherein thou mayst see as in an urinal-glasse, the dangerous state of thy English mother, and the genius of the reforming physitians, in seeking her speedy cure, and lasting happinesse, unto all succeeding ages. / By Philo-Parl. Imprimatur, Ja: Cranford. Joceline, Nathaniel. England and Wales. Parliament. aut
[16], 122, [2] p. : ill. (woodcut)
Printed for E. Blackmore, and are to be sold at his shop at the signe of the Angel in S. Pauls Church-yard, London : M DC XLIV. [1644]
Dedication to Lady Dudley signed: Nathaniell Ioceline. "An ordinance of the Lords and Commons assembled in Parliment, .. Feb. 16. Printed for Iohn Wright", originally published in 1642, has separate title page with imprint of the original edition; register is continuous. The last leaf bears: A generall receipt for all diseases spirituall. Annotation on Thomason copy: "May 7th"; "N/Joceline". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
Parliament physick for a sin-sick nation. Or, An ordinance of Parliament explained, and applyed to these diseased times. Containing a catholicall medicine for all natures and nations, but especially, a generall receipt for all the sickly people in our English-hospitall, and Welch-spittle, compounded after the art of the apothecary, and according to Parliament prescription, as hereafter followeth. Wherein thou mayst see as in an urinal-glasse, the dangerous state of thy English mother, and the genius of the reforming physitians, in seeking her speedy cure, and lasting happinesse, unto all succeeding ages. / By Philo-Parl. Imprimatur, Ja: Cranford. Joceline, Nathaniel. England and Wales. Parliament. aut
[16], 122, [2] p. : ill. (woodcut)
Printed for E. Blackmore, and are to be sold at his shop at the signe of the Angel in S. Pauls Church-yard, London : M DC XLIV. [1644]
Dedication to Lady Dudley signed: Nathaniell Ioceline. "An ordinance of the Lords and Commons assembled in Parliment, .. Feb. 16. Printed for Iohn Wright", originally published in 1642, has separate title page with imprint of the original edition; register is continuous. The last leaf bears: A generall receipt for all diseases spirituall. Annotation on Thomason copy: "May 7th"; "N/Joceline". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

his shop at the signe of the Angel in S. Pauls Church-yard
